Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class MageEnemy

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.GameObject
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Obstacle
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Enemy
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.MageEnemy
public class MageEnemy extends Enemy
A stationary ranged enemy that fires magic bolts at the player. The mage doesn't move but compensates by having long-range attacks.

Attack pattern: 1. Detects player within 250 pixel range 2. Checks if there's line of sight (no walls blocking) 3. Charges for 1 second (plays attack animation) 4. Fires a magic bolt (GameScreen spawns the projectile) 5. Cooldown for 2 seconds before next shot

Stats: 0 speed (stationary), 250f detection range, 1 damage, 2 health Uses 'mage_*.png' animations for idle, hurt, attack, and death states.

  • Constructor Details

    • MageEnemy

      public MageEnemy(float x, float y, MazeRunnerGame game)
      Creates a new stationary mage enemy at the specified position. The mage will automatically track and shoot at the player when in range.
      Parameters:
      x - x position in world coordinates
      y - y position in world coordinates
      game - reference to main game for accessing mage animation assets

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(float delta, Player player, MapManager mapManager)
      Updates the mage's combat logic and animations. Completely overrides the parent update to avoid movement/pathfinding logic since the mage is stationary. Handles: - Death animation timing - Hurt effect timing - Direction calculation (mage faces the player) - Charging and firing logic - Contact damage if player touches the mage
      Overrides:
      update in class Enemy
      Parameters:
      delta - time passed since last frame in seconds
      player - reference to the player for targeting
      mapManager - reference to the map for line of sight checks

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
      Draws the mage with special visual effects. Shows a red tint when recently hit by the player.
      Overrides:
      draw in class Enemy
      Parameters:
      batch - the LibGDX batch used for rendering

    • hasShotReady

      public boolean hasShotReady()
      Checks if the mage has a shot ready to fire. This is called by GameScreen to know when to spawn a MageBolt projectile. Automatically resets the flag after being read.
      Returns:
      true if a bolt should be spawned this frame, false otherwise

    • isCharging

      public boolean isCharging()
      Checks if the mage is currently charging up a shot. Can be used for visual effects or UI indicators.
      Returns:
      true if the mage is charging, false otherwise
